title: Richard Feynman Proposes Quantum Computing
overview: Richard Feynman and Yuri Manin propose quantum computing as a way to simulate physics problems beyond the capabilities of classical machines.

title: Shor’s Algorithm
overview: Peter Shor develops a quantum algorithm that can factor large numbers exponentially faster than classical computers, threatening RSA encryption.

title: IBM 5-Qubit Quantum Demonstration
overview: IBM demonstrates a 5-qubit quantum computer successfully implementing Shor’s algorithm, a landmark proof-of-concept in quantum computation.

title: D-Wave Ships First Quantum Computer
overview: D-Wave delivers the 128-qubit D-Wave One, the first commercially sold quantum computer, based on quantum annealing.

title: Google Achieves Quantum Supremacy
overview: Google’s Sycamore processor performs a calculation in 200 seconds that would take the fastest classical supercomputer thousands of years.

title: IBM Quantum Roadmap
overview: IBM unveils its roadmap to scale quantum processors to over 1,000 qubits, setting the stage for practical quantum advantage.

title: Quantum Cryptography Trials
overview: Quantum key distribution (QKD) trials expand across Europe and Asia, testing secure communications immune to eavesdropping.

title: AI–Quantum Synergy Research
overview: AI and quantum computing begin converging in research, with machine learning models optimized using quantum circuits.
